urls.title: Environment Agency launches World Ocean Day resources for schools
urls.description: Schools across England will mark World Ocean Day (WOD) next month (Tuesday 8 June) by exploring the journey of plastic with the Environment Agency.

tweets.text: Our #PreventingPlasticPollution partner @EnvAgency has created an interactive schools resource to help pupils explore the journey of plastic from source 💧 to sea 🌫️culminating in a Q&A with them & @WWF on #WorldOceanDay in June.  More at https://t.co/24UwywoJ4H @Plastics_EU https://t.co/dymwvs0fu7
@HNEscapesCIC @HibbsA @AaronBell4NUL @NewsNBC @EnvAgency @HouseofCommons It's as though it's denser than air and takes the line of the Lyme Valley down to the Trent.🤢

tweets.text:
Landfill update: it’s emerged that in May 2020, hydrogen sulphide levels on site were measured at 4610ppm! 20ppm can cause eye irritation; 1000ppm can cause death.

@EnvAgencyMids you let this happen. Why is the site still taking waste today? https://t.co/G4L1hSmuNb

Just before mayfly time, tributary of the anton/test. You could not make this up. Talk about brass neck.
@rivercide_live @sascampaigns @Feargal_Sharkey #sewage #pollution #environment https://t.co/Cz4CoHOAS6

Well done @EnvAgency Walleys Stench is over the whole of Newcastle Today and it is an atrocity. A solid 5 outside my house as I write. #Shame @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe

Our new flood warning area in #Farnborough goes live this week. This covers the Cove Brook in West Farnborough, including West Heath and Rafborough. Flood warnings give you valuable time to prepare for flooding. Sign up to receive flood warnings today https://t.co/uTUpj7qsMD https://t.co/jE0hh9FOKt

These levels of H2S are more typical of a site that has mixed construction and demolition waste, i.e. gypsum containing materials with organic waste.https://t.co/GEou2JZiFn #stopthe stink @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC https://t.co/vJli4tW5Xx

tweets.text: After a benign April, @thameswater is now back pumping raw sewage into the Thames. Remember - this should happen in exceptional circumstances only - not every time it rains. A CSO alert means the Thames is rinsed with shit, wet wipes and sanitary products. A national scandal https://t.co/v4hx90rLOd

HISTORIC MOMENT - shad are through the Diglis fish pass👏
Blocked for 180yrs, these speedy shad are wasting no time now & heading upriver to spawn #FollowTheShad #SevernShadRun #FishMigration @CanalRiverTrust @SevenRivers @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @HullUniScience @ChrisGPackham https://t.co/zHQ1Onfjg5

Why are the authorities @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK so slow to act? It's exactly the same with banning woodburning in urban areas and tackling #AirPollution - feet dragging all the way https://t.co/UzPO1YkgKF

@ANger23819064 @Rebecca35327097 Yes @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @MPGeorgeEustice please take note we have had enough of being poisoned on a daily basis it contravenes our human rights which makes you criminally liable unless you get this sorted.
@StinkStopthe

Thought I was imagining the wafts but no - the nauseating landfill fumes start have started to infest The Westlands after a few evenings reprieve. Hope others are getting a break tonight! @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK #stopthestink @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock https://t.co/Ce9YCciF5r

Another major toxic fallout from #WalleysQuarryLtd. Thanks @RedIndustries2 of it's not our smell fame. How convenient, if not embarrassing, we are just having our annual gas service. Thanks also @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA for leaving us to suffocate.

India deported me but I asked a lawyer from Japan to continue my complaint I lodged before Human Rights Commission. This nut in North Division didn't know how to call numbers and blamed me in his report. My reply totals 7 pages. Already submitted to Human Rights Commission. FUCK. https://t.co/WsFDGOs74C

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
